text_section1.text: After he met the old woman strange things happened to Tracy. He still walked the Earth. He breathed, he existed. Yet to those who had known him, he was...
The Man Who Never Lived
Cooper, you know me. I'm William Tracy! I collect books! You know I'm real, don't you? Tell me! Tell me that I'm real!
Of - of course you're real, Mr. Tracy. What is it? What's wrong?

text_section2.text: You do know me! At last! You can help me! I'll tell you the whole story so you'll see that I'm not crazy!

text_section1.text: It started right there, a month ago! There, by that rack! That was where I met the old woman!
As he told it, Tracy wept. Someone believed him at last. But he still had to tell of it. He had to tell about - her. How it had begun...
Do you mind letting go, Madam? I saw this book first. It will fit perfectly into my collection!

text_section2.text: And I want it for other reasons. So - yes, I do mind!

text_section1.text: Do you, really!
The old hag stumbled. But Tracy was not one who was filled with the milk of human kindness...

text_section2.text: I'm sorry, but you should have let go! I always get what I want. And I want this book. I'm William Tracy!

text_section3.text: William Tracy - the banker. I know! You're a very important man. And very selfish...

text_section1.text: How dare you!

text_section2.text: Everyone knows William Tracy! That's important to you, isn't it? Being known... being a celebrity... a public figure! So - perhaps that is what your punishment should be. To be forgotten, wiped out...

text_section1.text: Ha! Ha! ... Don't take this book too seriously, old lady! Sorcery, indeed!
Scoff at me! Laugh at the ancient arts of magic - while you're still able, Mr. Tracy! While you're still able!
The hag's eyes blazed. But Tracy only laughed at her curses, and when home with his prize...
I'm sorry, sir, but no one is at home!

text_section2.text: Of course not! Have you gone out of your mind, Loomis? Or don't you know your own employer?

text_section1.text: Employer? I don't know you, sir. This is the home of William Tracy.

text_section2.text: You have lost your mind! I'm William Tracy! This is my house! Get out of my way!

text_section1.text: Please, sir! I abhor the use of violence!
Tracy had not understood at first. His own butler had barred his way, so...

text_section2.text: Swanson, you know me! I live in this building!...

text_section3.text: Not in this building! I know my tenants! You, I never saw before!

text_section1.text: After that, it had been a nightmare...

text_section2.text: Jamieson, you're my lawyer! I've got to see you!

text_section3.text: Your name is Tracy? I'm afraid you've made a mistake! I don't have a client by that name.

text_section1.text: Tracy had even attempted force, in the end...

text_section2.text: Let me in! I tell you I've got to see Jamieson! He's my attorney! No one else remembers me!

text_section3.text: Adn neither does Mr. Jamieson! He refuses to see you. Get out!

text_section1.text: But force had not been the answer...

text_section2.text: I've got to see him! I've got to!

text_section1.text: This is his apartment...
I was right! He was trying to break in! I knew I heard something! I've got him!

text_section2.text: No! Jamieson! It's me! Tracy! Don't you know me?

text_section1.text: I never saw you before in my life! Mason! Call the police!
It was the police who had listened at last, disbelieving. But they had taken Tracy down-town...
Well, that's it. This is the hall of records, Mister. And there's no record or a William Tracy ever being born!

text_section2.text: What is this, anyway? A practical joke? ... no... no, I can see you're all dead serious!

text_section1.text: But I'm here! I exist! There must be one person who can remembers me!
And I'll find him! I'll find someone who can identify me! I'll find out what this is all about!
I do exist! I do!
Somehow, Tracy had gotten away. So now, at the book shop...

text_section2.text: Don't you see? I've won! I've beaten her! You know me! You can prove to everyone who I am!

text_section3.text: Sure, Mr. Tracy, sure. I close in ten minutes! You just wait and I'll go with you to the police!

text_section1.text: All right! I'll wait outside! I'll show her! I'll show everyone they can't make a fool of William Tracy! They'll regret it!
Tracy went out... And he never noticed the old woman. He did not see her smile.
An odd man, Mr. Cooper. He seemed quite upset! Is he a friend of yours? He seemed like a very odd man, indeed.
Tracy did not see the old woman's eyes. He did not hear Coopers words. Cooper - who was his last hope.

text_section2.text: He? I'm afraid I don't understand. What man? Except for you, there hasn't been a customer in the shop for hours.

text_section3.text: This story may have happened. No one knows for sure. Unless, of course, it's Tracy -- he swears that he was invisible for days! -- and you kind of wanted to believe him! -- He's such a kind, considerate, solid man... today!
